intro: Pentameris swartbergensis, commonly known as the Swartberg pentameris, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is found in the mountainous regions of the Western Cape. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Pentameris swartbergensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its arid and semi-arid habitats.
